newsitem.title: SUDAN: Sudan raises tariffs to protect local industry.
newsitem.headline: Sudan raises tariffs to protect local industry.

text.p: Sudan increased tariffs on some imported products and reduced or cancelled those on industrial and agricultural inputs to protect local industry, a newspaper on Tuesday quoted the minister of industry as saying.

"The presidential decrees aim to protect the local industry from unfair competition from imports," the government-owned daily Al-Anbaa quoted Minister of Industry Badr Al-Din Suleiman as telling parliament.
The measures include a reduction of duties on plastic inputs to five from ten percent but a sharp increase tariffs on imported plastic products to 30 from five percent, the paper said.
The moves come after local industrialists complained they were being driven out of business by uncontrolled imports, which locals prefer because the imports are seen as better quality.
While all taxes on wheat grain imports and local flour mills were cancelled, a 10-percent consumption tax and an additional five percent import tax were imposed on imported flour, it said.
